We took an all day bus tour (Evan Evans), including the London Eye.
We *just* got back into Washington last evening, after our brief 5-day trip to London
We *just* got back into Washington last evening, after our brief 5-day trip to London
After that, we took the underground into London
We got into Heathrow on Monday morning
At the airport, I got some cash from the Barclays ATM just outside the arrival area, as many have suggested

After that, we took the underground into London
That was pretty easy... the most difficult part was finding the hotel once we finally got off at the final tube station
It seemed like a kind of local place, and the woman that was running the place was very nice
I gathered (from that and a few visits at other pubs) that that's the norm.
That night, we walked around the area around the Victoria underground station, because we were suppose to meet up with a tour the next morning

Prices here were a bit cheaper than the local foodstore, and during our trip, I made several trips here
At the end of the land tour, we went on ride on one of the Thames cruise boats (warning, it is FREEZING on the top deck...), and then a ride on the London Eye
one of the Thames cruise boats
We also took one of the hop-on/hop-off bus tours (the "Original") on one of the other day, as we thought it was the easiest way to get around to the places that we wanted to re-visit
the places that we wanted to re-visit

We had been buying the 2-zone all-day tube passes (4.20 GBP each) everyday, just to get around to dinner and shopping on our own, but by the time this was all over, my wife didn't feel like taking the underground back to Heathrow, so we had asked the hotel conceierge to make a reservation on an airport bus (15 GBP each), but he instead offered that he could get us a private car direct to the airport for 35 GBP, which is what we did.
This was perfect, because it got us door-to-door from the hotel to LHR Terminal 3 with no hassles at all
This was perfect, because it got us door-to-door from the hotel to LHR Terminal 3 with no hassles at all
Overall, it was an enjoyable, but really exhausting trip (we live in the suburbs, so I guess we're not use to walking everywhere

I think that if I was dealing in GPBs all the time, it wouldn't seem so bad, but I remember sitting at the ice cream ("gelato"?) counter at Harrods, and watching two little kids, each eating some sundaes that cost 15 GPB each ($30.00), and thinking "wow!".
Harrods is Harrods though, and most people go there to be blown away by the prices
